Pre-Game Insights: Patrick Mabedi admitted that the Flames had no choice but to get a positive result against the Stallions tonight.
Mabedi said everything is possible in football and that the best way of defending is attacking.
Mabedi is likely to make changes to the side that started against Burundi, with Captain John Banda likely to be thrown into the fray and Lawrence Chaziya given a chance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is scheduled to kick off at 9pm (21:00 hours) local time in Bamako, Mali.
Malawi and Burkina Faso are separated by 59 places on Fifa rankings, with the Stallions on 67 whereas the Flames are 126 in the world.
The two sides have a history of matches, with the Stallions having won four matches and drawn twice against Malawi since 2000.
Others: Roy Abramo Mâ€™dechi said Malawi must beat Burkina Faso to remain in contention in Group L.
The Flames started the 2025 Afcon qualifiers with a surprise 3-2 defeat to Burundi at Bingu National Stadium.
